intro: Vibo australis, commonly known as the southern vibora, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods contain edible seeds that are used in traditional cuisines. Vibo australis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and small animals.
